name: Ionian Sun Apartments and Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a stay at the Ionian Sun.
reviews.title: Lourdas Lovely - Ionian Sun Not So

reviews.text: To start on a positive the resort is a lovely quiet place with nice places to eat = La Mer, Olive Lounge etc, avoid Lorraines bizarre menu and average food and Lithero at the end of the beach nice views but poor food, atmosphere and costly for it, although great views.
reviews.title: Beautiful place - a family favourite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartmenst were a big let down, the staff firstly are unwelcoming and often rude. The lady in the bar is a mix of nice today, awful tomorrow and very opinionated, she needs some lessons in customer service and plain good manners.
reviews.title: Ionian Sun, Kefalonia - Great Holiday !

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ionian Sands villa, part of the Ionian Sun complex, for 2 weeks in August 2010. I went with my husband, 18-month old son, mother-in-law, and then my brother and his wife and 3 children stayed in the adjoining Ionian Beach villa.
reviews.title: Ionian Sands villa - lovely place, I miss it already!

reviews.text: The villa was better than I expected. It was clean, modern, nicely decorated, with all the amenities you would need. The air conditioning worked perfectly. The cleaners came every few days to clean and also change the sheets and towels, which was great. But the best thing was the outside space. It is awesome. Lots of loungers with parasols, a lounge area with sofa and chairs, a table and chairs, and an infinity pool. The view out over Lourdas bay is breathtaking. It was such a nice place to hang out. It was plenty big enough as well. The Ionian Beach villa was very nice as well. It has less shade but a slightly better view over the bay. I preferred Ionian Sands as I liked all the greenery and there was more shade.
reviews.title: A quiet chilled out location.

reviews.text: There are steps through the trees down to the Ionian Sun pool area with bar. If you have any degree of fitness these are no problem, going up or down. Good to get the calf muscles working! But really, if you can't manage these, you need to think about how unfit you are. And as it's through the trees it's nice and shady.
reviews.title: Young children are welcome too!

reviews.text: The pool area is fine, not amazing, but fine. We often went in the morning to have a coffee and the kids would play in the pool. It's a good sized pool, and there always seemed to be loungers available, it wasn't too busy. We never had food there so I can't comment on that. They also serve drinks and have ice creams. Belle behind the bar was very nice, yes, she can be moody but she's a nice lady. In general we preferred the pool in our villa as it was more private and relaxing. Also, in the second week the pool bar pool looked a bit green and was too warm.
reviews.title: No 53, Ionian Gloom, and rodents

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the pool bar it's just some steps down to Lourdas beach. The beach is very wide, and there was never a problem getting loungers or anything, it's not too busy. It's a bit pebbly, and there was some kind of fish in the shallow water which kept nipping at my ankles! But not leaving marks or anything, just annoying. However, by far a better beach is Trapezeki beach, which is just around the corner, a short drive. It is gorgeous, all sandy, shallow water for very far out, and a really cool beach bar with great music. It is such a better beach - forget Lourdas beach, go to Trapezeki, trust me! You can park your car just by the beach. There may be a way to walk there around the headland as well, I'm not sure.
reviews.title: Ionian Sun - Lovely place!
